page.title: 17ARABLE FARMING _ TILMANSTONE
page.content: The majority of{farmland}round the village is{arable,}some crops grown in {rotation.}Currently farmed are{winter {barley, wheat}and{oats. Oil seed rape is widely grown as a{break crop;}its bright yellow blossom and pungent scent are a feature of springtime. {Potatoes, brussels sprouts}and{peas are raised in fields of about 25 acres. 1985 saw a test crop of{linseed grown in a small area near the Plough & Harrow pub, to the west of the A256. Summer{grass crops,}surplus to immed_ iate needs are made into{silage}or{hay for winter feed. {Straw}left behind after{harvesting is the subject of great controversy. Some is used as{winter bedding}and {feed,}but much is burned, causing {pollution}from smoke and smuts. Pres_ sure to find new or alternative uses for straw is increasing.
